metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1193 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 10.0.648.127, allows remoteattackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
